ids_alerts.rule_msg: ET INFO DYNAMIC_DNS Query to a *.dns .army Domain
ids_alerts.rule_raw: alert dns $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"ET INFO DYNAMIC_DNS Query to a *.dns .army Domain"; dns.query; content:".dns.army"; fast_pattern; nocase; endswith; reference:url,dynv6.com/; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2042831; rev:2; metadata:attack_target Client_and_Server, created_at 2022_12_14, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Low, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2023_03_02, mitre_tactic_id TA0011, mitre_tactic_name Command_And_Control, mitre_technique_id T1568, mitre_technique_name Dynamic_Resolution;)

mitre_attack_techniques.signature_description: Executes commands using a shell command-line interpreter
Executes the "systemctl" command used for controlling the systemd system and service manager
Creates hidden files, links and/or directories
Uses the "uname" system call to query kernel version information (possible evasion)
Reads the 'hosts' file potentially containing internal network hosts

signature_matches.description: All HTTP servers contacted by the sample do not answer. The sample is likely an old dropper which does no longer work.
Reads the 'hosts' file potentially containing internal network hosts
Connects to IPs without corresponding DNS lookups
May try to detect the virtual machine to hinder analysis (VM artifact strings found in memory)

signature_matches.description: Executes commands using a shell command-line interpreter
Executes the "systemctl" command used for controlling the systemd system and service manager
Tries to connect to HTTP servers, but all servers are down (expired dropper behavior)
Sample contains strings indicative of BusyBox which embeds multiple Unix commands in a single executable
